posts.post_content:
For sale I have a cdv picturing nine soldiers/cadets with a bat and a ball included in the image.  Stylistically this would appear to be an early cdv.  I would place it no later than the late 1860s and possibly earlier.  
$1250 OBO.  PP.

I believe this is one of the original sellers, Originally from Guernsey, apprenticed here and eventually went back home and opened a library that's still there. 
[url]https://guernseypress.com/news/2006/07/15/librarys-history-has-many-chapters/[/url]

Better info on his NY career here [url]https://books.google.com/books?id=DFAwAQAAMAAJ&pg=PR3&lpg=PR3&dq=Frederick+Mansell+Alles&source=bl&ots=ZSdy5cdbBa&sig=ri-srB9dZHCXgXu08_nXO2J9JNY&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiSgZrEpM7ZAhXo54MKHS9MDF84ChDoAQhQMAU#v=onepage&q=Frederick%20Mansell%20Alles&f=false[/url]
pages i through iii 
He apparently left the business and moved back to Guernsey in 1869, Alles moved back sometime before 1881. 

Nice photo, whish I could afford it, and just wanted to add that little bit I looked up.
Thanks for the information, Steve.  It verifies my dating as being late 1860s or earlier.
